block.p: Caroline Rivers Curry and Robert Hughes Davis Jr. were married yesterday by the Rev. Bruce Curry Page, a cousin of the bride, at Circular Congregation Church in Charleston, S.C.

The bride and bridegroom, both 32, are stock analysts. She covers pharmaceutical companies for Goldman, Sachs in New York; he covers technology companies for SSB Citi Asset Management in Stamford, Conn., a unit of Citigroup. The bride, a graduate of Swarthmore College, and the bridegroom, who graduated from the University of California at Irvine, received M.B.A.s from the University of Pennsylvania, where they met.
Caroline Rivers Curry and Robert Hughes Davis Jr. were married yesterday by the Rev. Bruce Curry Page, a cousin of the bride, at Circular Congregation Church in Charleston, S.C.

The bride and bridegroom, both 32, are stock analysts. She covers pharmaceutical companies for Goldman, Sachs in New York; he covers technology companies for SSB Citi Asset Management in Stamford, Conn., a unit of Citigroup. The bride, a graduate of Swarthmore College, and the bridegroom, who graduated from the University of California at Irvine, received M.B.A.s from the University of Pennsylvania, where they met.

Ms. Curry, who is keeping her name, is a daughter of Elizabeth Rivers Curry and Ravenel Boykin Curry III of Manhattan. Her mother and father are money managers at Eagle Capital Management in Manhattan.

Mr. Davis is a son of Shirley Jean Davis and Robert Hughes Davis of Pasadena, Calif. His father is the director of planned giving, in charge of alumni fund-raising, for the University of Southern California.
